headline: Why Waters Corporation (WAT) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of scientific instruments company Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) fell 9% in the morning session after the company reported disappointing fourth quarter results: Its revenue and EPS guidance for next quarter fell short of Wall Street's estimates. whole, was underwhelming. The company highlighted headwinds related to foreign exchange, volume, and inflation. Also, the sales outlook suggests growth will trudge along in the mid-single digits, given foreign exchange pressures.

headline: Waters forecasts first-quarter profit below estimates on stronger dollar
summary: The lab equipment maker expects adjusted profit between $2.17 and $2.25 per share, below analysts' average estimate of $2.42 per share, according to data compiled by LSEG.  It also forecast 2025 adjusted profit between $12.70 and $13.00 per share, in line with analysts' expectations of $12.85 per share.

headline: Waters: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of seven analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $4.02 per share. The maker of products used in drug discovery and development posted revenue of $872.7 million in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Five analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $857.1 million.

headline: Waters Corporation’s (NYSE:WAT) Q4: Beats On Revenue But Quarterly Revenue Guidance Significantly Misses Expectations
summary: Scientific instruments company Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2024, with sales up 6.5% year on year to $872.7 million. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $652.8 million was less impressive, coming in 2.8% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.10 per share was 1.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
